uk.ac.ox.cs.diadem.webapi

Interface WebBrowser

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, MiniBrowser
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractWebBrowser, WebDriverBrowserImpl

    public interface WebBrowser
extends AutoCloseable, MiniBrowser
    Author:
    Giovanni Grasso (giovannigrasso@gmail.com) Oxford University, Department of Computer Science

      • navigateAndStatus

        int navigateAndStatus(URI uri)
        Uses MiniBrowser.navigate(URI) to navigates on the page and returns the HTTP status code (which might require another page fetching in case of BrowserFactory.Engine.WEBDRIVER_FF)
        Parameters:
        uri -
        Returns:

      • navigate

        @Deprecated
void navigate(String uRI,
                          boolean waitUntilLoaded)
        Deprecated. replaced by navigate(String, boolean)()
        Navigate to the given URL.
        Parameters:
        waitUntilLoaded - if true, it runs synchronously, waiting for the fully loaded page. This is always the case for the browser WebBrowserBuilder.Engine.WEBDRIVER_FF
        uRI -
        Throws:
        a - WebAPITimeoutException if the set timeout is exceeded

        unit -

      • getWindowFrame

        Object getWindowFrame()
        INTERNAL API SUBJECT TO CHANGE Return the Window frame used by the underlying browser instantiated. For Engine#SWT_MOZILLA it returns a Composite while for Engine#HTMLUNIT it returns the com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.WebClient, and for WebDriver returns the underlying driver
        Returns:

      • setDialogsService

        void setDialogsService(DialogsService service)
        Sets a new DialogsService. You can use this method to register your own DialogsService implementation in which you can specify the required behavior during displaying any browser dialog such as alert, confirmation, JavaScript error dialog.
        Parameters:
        service - the service to set

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Kills the current browser and allElements other instances, closing the application. Use thisclose() to close only the current browser instance.
        Specified by:
